page.title: 08Sutton Courtenay Church.
page.content: In the village of Sutton Courtenay there is a{church}which is 900 years old. In the first place the church was part of Abingdon Abbey. There are some fifteenth century pews and one of them looks like the tree it was made of! During the English Civil War the east window was blown out and the church was used as a gunpowder store. In the{churchyard}the vicar showed us the grave of Eric Arthur Blair. He is better known as the writer George Orwell. In 1948 Orwell wrote a book called 1984 which was supposed to be his vision of Britain in 1984. It is not a very nice description and I am glad that his prediction did not come true. I do not think that Big Brother is watching me!
